meanings.definition: To officially agree to or accept something
meanings.sent1: The teacher will approve the students' project proposals.
meanings.sent2: The committee will approve the budget for the new project.
meanings.sent3: The cat will approve the new brand of cat food with a purr of satisfaction.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to approve the flowers by shining brightly upon them.
meanings.sent5: The judge's approving smile signaled the end of the trial.

meanings.definition: To think that something is good or acceptable
meanings.sent1: I approve of your choice to study hard for the exam.
meanings.sent2: She will approve of the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to approve of the idea of a long walk in the park.
meanings.sent4: The stars above seemed to approve of the lovers' midnight picnic.
meanings.sent5: The crowd's cheers seemed to approve of the singer's performance.
